Title: Top Gun
Description: As students at the United States Navy elite fighter weapons school compete to be best in the class, one daring young pilot learns a few things from a civilian instructor that are not taught in the classroom.

Genre.Name: romantic
Genre.Description: Romance films involve romantic love stories recorded in visual media for broadcasts in theaters or on television that focus on passion, emotion, and the affectionate romantic involvement of the main characters.

Director.Name: Tony Scott
Director.Bio: Tony Scott was a British-born film director and producer. He was the youngest of three brothers, one of whom is fellow film director Ridley Scott.

Title: The Godfather
Description: Don Vito Corleone, head of a mafia family, decides to hand over his empire to his youngest son Michael. However, his decision unintentionally puts the lives of his loved ones in grave danger.

Genre.Name: action
Genre.Description: Action movies usually have a lot of violent things, like explosions, blood, and fight scenes. It can also have elements of comedy, drama, and spy fiction.

Director.Name: Francis Ford Cappola
Director.Bio: Francis Ford Coppola was born in 1939 in Detroit, Michigan, but grew up in a New York suburb in a creative, supportive Italian-American family.

Title: Casablanca
Description: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

Genre.Name: romantic
Genre.Description: Romance films involve romantic love stories recorded in visual media for broadcasts in theaters or on television that focus on passion, emotion, and the affectionate romantic involvement of the main characters.

Director.Name: Michael Curtiz
Director.Bio: Curtiz began acting in and then directing films in his native Hungary in 1912.

Title: Gone with the wind
Description: A sheltered and manipulative Southern belle and a roguish profiteer face off in a turbulent romance as the society around them crumbles with the end of slavery and is rebuilt during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

Genre.Name: romantic

Director.Name: Sam Wood
Director.Bio: Sam Wood was a film director, and producer, with a reputation for reliability, a no-nonsense approach and with an ability to finish a project on time and under budget.

Title: Citizen Kane
Description: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance Rosebud

Genre.Name: drama
Genre.Description: Dramas follow a clearly defined narrative plot structure, portraying real-life scenarios or extreme situations with emotionally-driven characters.

Title: Touch of Evil
Description: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

Title: The Trial
Description: An unassuming office worker is arrested and stands trial, but he is never made aware of his charges.

Title: The Sound of Music
Description: A young novice is sent by her convent in 1930s Austria to become a governess to the seven children of a widowed naval officer.

Genre.Name: musical
Genre.Description: Musical film is a film genre in which songs by the characters are interwoven into the narrative, sometimes accompanied by dancing.

Director.Name: Robert Zemeckis

Title: West Side Story
Description: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
